text: AWS is providing GoPros ability to
quickly build the GoPro Plus service as
well as all of our needs from our
website to our commerce to running all
the services for our customers I'm Joe
Bentley I'm VP of engineering at GoPro
this year's a phenomenal year ago Pro
because we've launched into new markets
both with the drone as well as our new
cloud service Gover + bringing a new
GoPro plus service to the cloud this is
a user-generated content service where
we're allowing customers to upload their
content directly to the cloud both
directly from the camera as well as
their desktop and we needed a Transco
service ETS particularly that can handle
both the pipeline's that we see from
user-generated content as well as the
video quality and our headline feature
was cameras a hub and this enables
customers to upload their content
directly from the camera to the cloud
this feature was enabled by a WSS IOT
services and without that we wouldn't
have been able to launch that headline
feature we have new capability now in
our cameras to include metadata with
that so by working with the AWS and the
ETS team we were able to now ensure that
that metadata is intact as it flows
through the ETS service and these were
really key to the new services we wanted
to launch this year we've rewritten all
of our micro services to be stateless
and then wiring them to cloud watch has
what enabled the service allows us to
auto scale up and down both directions
and contain our cost we did work with
the wide range of folks across the sales
organization but if there's any group
I'd have to call out that really helped
us is the support team our DevOps
organization relies on them almost a
daily basis and what's truly phenomenal
is we're able to file tickets
and the support teams jump on those and
gets us tickets often resolved by the
time the team arrives in the office in
the morning given that we've launched a
new service and this is a brand new load
that we're seeing with a lot of gross
things so we're beginning to tune the
services this year and the support has
been phenomenal
